page.title: 14FRAMPTON
page.content: FRAMPTON Frampton is considered to be one of the prettiest villages around Boston. The village is grouped arouned the church and consists of private houses, Frampton Hall ,a large country house built in 1725,and a public house ,the Moore's Arms. As at Wyberton the village itself has grown only a little but has developed rapidly along the Spalding to Boston road whichis beyond the limits of this survey. The church was St. Mary was mentioned in the Domesday survey, although it's thought that that church was built of wood.The fine tower with it's early broach spire was built in the twelth century and the remainder of the church was rebuilt in 1310.
